D.19.2 Are web facilities available for routine and emergency communication?
D.19.3 Does the PHC/UPHC have adequate and spacious stores located away from patient traffic with facility for storage?
D.19.4 Are the drugs arranged on the racks in alphabetical/pharmacological order?
D.19.5 Are the buffer stocks kept in separate spaces or cupboards in the drug store?
D.19.6 Is a special provision of lock and key ensured for storage of Narcotic and Psychotropic medicines?
D.19.7 Are the heavier items stored on the lower shelves of racks?
D.19.8 Does the store have space clearly earmarked for keeping necessary records and registers?
D.19.9 Is a proper Bin Card system of collection and storage of medicines followed?
D.19.10 Is the digitalization of medical records being done while adhering to the data security guidelines of GoI?
D.19.11 Are all the essential medical staff and allied health professionals provided with residential accommodation?
D.19.12 Are transport arrangements for staff available to work at remote facilities?
D.19.13 Are dietary services available at the PHC?
D.19.14 Is oxygen cylinder/concentrator facility available to manage patients with COVID 19 or other emergency?
D.19.15 Is a flowmeter with pressure regulator available for each bed supported with oxygen supply?
D.19.16 Are the oxygen cylinders stored in a dry, well-ventilated separate area?

I.2.8 Are any drugs not prescribed under their generic names?

I.2.17 Is the safety of those handling the material before, during and after transport ensured?
I.2.18 Is the sample collection and dispersal of test results done during OPD hours?
I.2.19 Are the turnaround times for test results standardized, adhered to and monitored?
I.2.20 Is the validation of procedures and equipment been done and recorded?
